intro: Farsetia inconspicua, commonly known as the slender farsetia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the wet tropical forests of Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pale green flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Farsetia inconspicua is adapted to high humidity and shade, making it a common understory plant in tropical rainforests.
